User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) 

Currently it is possible to build many-to-many filters, but it is tiresome.

You pick up account A, add filters. Then you pick up account B, and add filters (the same ones).

Much more faster it would be with direct ability to build such relations -- two panes (instead of combobox with accounts and pane with filters) -- in first pane list of filters, in second  -- checkbox list with accounts.

So you add new filter and then select account A and B. Done, you defined a filter for two accounts _at once_.


Reproducible: Always
comments.creator: bluedzins@wp.pl
